arguments.name: var
arguments.description: The name of a simple or complex variable to display. Useful for displaying a temporary value, or a value that does not display on any CFM page.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: string, which can include simple variable, but not complex variables such as arrays.

arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
Corresponds to the cflog type attribute:
- Information
- Warning
- Error
- Fatal Information

arguments.name: category
arguments.description: string name for identifying trace groups

arguments.name: inline
arguments.description:
if true displays trace code in line on the page in the location of the trace function, 
addition to the debugging information output.

arguments.name: abort
arguments.description: stops further processing of the request.

arguments.name: follow
arguments.description: If true, Railo follows the variable defined in the [var] attribute and will log any changes to it. Ignored when attribute [var] is not defined.

name: trace
description:
Displays and logs debugging data about the state of an application at the time this function executes. 
Tracks runtime logic flow, variable values, and execution time. Displays output at the end of the request or in the debugging section at the end of the request.
